author: Redacción Correo
title: Multan a la MPCh por vulnerar derechos de personas con discapacidad | EDICION | CORREO
text: El Consejo Nacional para la Integración de la Persona con Discapacidad (Conadis) impuso una multa de S/ 118,450 a la Municipalidad Provincial de Chiclayo (MPCh) por incurrir en graves vulneraciones a los derechos de las [personas con discapacidad](https://diariocorreo.pe/edicion/lambayeque/gestion-de-gobernador-jorge-perez-deja-sin-local-a-personas-con-discapacidad-en-lambayeque-noticia/). El ente rector detectó que la actual gestión municipal de la alcaldesa, Janet Cubas Carranza, no cumple con la cuota laboral ni con ambientes accesibles para la población con discapacidad. En octubre de 2023, el Conadis fiscalizó in situ la sede administrativa de la MPCH, ubicada en la calle Elías Aguirre 240. En el lugar, los fiscalizadores detectaron graves vulneraciones a las normas de accesibilidad, al encontrar rampas con pendientes inadecuadas, módulos de atención inaccesibles para personas en silla de ruedas o de talla baja, señalética sin escritura Braille, y otros incumplimientos. En cuanto a la cuota de empleo, la cual para entidades públicas es del 5 % del total de trabajadores, el Conadis detectó que la comuna solo acreditó la contratación de 17 personas con discapacidad, de un total de 2024 servidores, lo que equivalía al 0.83 % de su planilla. Es por ello que, acatando la Ley General de la Persona con Discapacidad (Ley 29973), el Conadis sancionó a la MPCh con 11 UIT (S/ 56 650), por “contravenir las normas de accesibilidad en el entorno urbano y las edificaciones”; y con 12 UIT (S/ 61 800), por “el incumplimiento de la cuota de empleo de personas con discapacidad”. “A través de estas medidas correctivas, el Conadis busca que los gobiernos regionales y locales cumplan con la cuota de empleo y las normas de accesibilidad, para que las personas con discapacidad puedan ejercer sus derechos en igualdad de condiciones”, señaló la presidenta del Conadis, Sandra Piro Marcos. LEE AQUÍ: [Sindican a hermanastro del asesinato de joven madre de dos hijos en Lambayeque]

author: Todd Spangler
title: Netflix Most-Watched Licensed Content in First Half of 2024: ‘CoComelon,’ ‘Peppa Pig,’ ‘Young Sheldon’ Lead the Pack
text:
Netflix’s original shows and movies typically dominate the streamer’s most-viewed content rankings. But it still serves up hundreds of millions of hours of content licensed from third parties, as shown by Netflix’s massive data dump for viewing covering the first half of 2024.
Not surprisingly, kids content continues to fare well — extremely well. No. 1 on the TV side is perennial preschool favorite “CoComelon,” from Moonbug Entertainment, which pulled in 124.5 million views in aggregate. And that doesn’t include the two seasons of “CoComelon Lane” (34.4 million), which is a Netflix original produced by Moonbug. In addition, Moonbug’s “Little Angel” series garnered 52.4 million views over its five volumes.
Following “CoComelon” was another children’s TV staple: British animated show “Peppa Pig,” with 117.4 million views over six seasons. “Young Sheldon,” the spinoff the “The Big Bang Theory” that just ended its run on CBS last spring, came in strong with 106 million views across six seasons on Netflix.
“Suits,” which thanks to Netflix re-entered the zeitgeist years after ending its run on USA, also continued to perform well, with 81.2 million views across 9 seasons. Reruns of “The Walking Dead” (47.1 million) and “Breaking Bad” (38.0 million) also continued to pay off for Netflix.
Other notable licensed TV shows that ranked highly on Netflix’s report are Showtime’s “Dexter” (33.2 million views) and HBO’s “Sex and the City” (33.1 million).
“We’ve got a rich history of helping break some of TV’s biggest hits, like ‘Breaking Bad’ and ‘Walking Dead,’” co-CEO Ted Sarandos told analysts on Netflix’s earnings call in January. “Because of our recommendation, our reach, we can resurrect a show like ‘Suits’ and turn it into a big pop-culture moment but also generate billions of hours of joy for our members.”
Meanwhile, three of Netflix’s top 10 movies for the first half of 2024 were licensed — and were animated family films: Universal/Illumination’s “The Super Mario Bros. Movie” (80 million) and “Minions” (73 million), and DreamWorks Animation’s “The Boss Baby” (64 million)
Note that in many cases, Netflix does not have worldwide licensing rights for TV shows and movies. For example, “Big Bang Theory” is not available in the U.S. on Netflix; shows licensed from HBO (including “Sex and the City” and “Insecure”) are available in the U.S., Latin America, and some European and Asia-Pacific countries. Meanwhile, some content is available for limited periods: Tom Cruise’s “Top Gun: Maverick” was available in the U.S. for only few months in 2024; currently the film is available in Australia and several European countries on Netflix.
Netflix calculates views by dividing total hours viewed divided by runtime. Here’s a list of the most-watched licensed content on Netflix for the first half of 2024.
TV Shows
Show Studio Views CoComelon Moonbug Entertainment 124,500,000 Peppa Pig Hasbro 117,400,000 Young Sheldon Warner Bros. Television 105,800,000 Suits Universal Content Productions 81,200,000 Masha and the Bear Animaccord 70,200,000 Brooklyn Nine-Nine Universal Television 65,900,000 Big Bang Theory Warner Bros. Television 55,000,000 Little Angel Moonbug Entertainment 52,400,000 The Walking Dead AMC Studios 47,100,000 Bebefinn Pinkfong 39,800,000 Breaking Bad Sony Pictures Entertainment 38,000,000 Movies

Movie Universal/Illumination 80,300,000 Minions Universal/Illumination 72,700,000 The Boss Baby DreamWorks Animation 63,600,000 Despicable Me 3 Universal/Illumination 61,600,000 Shrek DreamWorks Animation 56,900,000 The Equalizer 3 Columbia Pictures 53,500,000 Trolls DreamWorks Animation 42,700,000 Sing 2 Universal/Illumination 40,400,000 Top Gun: Maverick Paramount Pictures/Skydance 37,100,000 Hotel Transylvania 2 Sony Pictures Animation 36,500,000

author: gustavozanfer
title: Mais de 30 mil membros do sindicato da Boeing anunciam 1ª greve em 16 anos
text:
Os membros do sindicato da Boeing rejeitaram esmagadoramente uma proposta de contrato de quatro anos com a problemática fabricante de aeronaves, causando a primeira greve na empresa em 16 anos, segundo o sindicato International Association of Machinist (IAM).
Cerca de 33.000 trabalhadores estão preparados para deixar o trabalho, e a greve está marcada para começar na manhã desta sexta-feira (13).
A greve praticamente interromperá a produção de aviões comerciais em um dos maiores gigantes da indústria da América e seu maior exportador, desferindo um golpe potencial na economia dos EUA.
Dependendo da duração da greve, ela pode causar problemas para quase 10.000 fornecedores da Boeing (BA), que podem ser encontrados em todos os 50 estados dos EUA.
A empresa tem um total de 150.000 funcionários nos EUA e estima sua contribuição anual para a economia americana em US$ 79 bilhões, gerando 1,6 milhão de empregos direta e indiretamente.
Leia Mais
EUA abrem investigação sobre mais de 781 mil Jeeps por causa de fogo sob capô
No Reino Unido, taxa de desemprego cai a 4,1% no trimestre até julho
Huawei acumula 3 milhões de pré-encomendas de celular que abre em Z O acordo rejeitado, que a liderança sindical descreveu como o melhor que já havia negociado com a Boeing, teria dado aumentos de pelo menos 25% ao longo da vida do acordo.
Também aumentou a segurança do emprego para os membros do sindicato, porque a Boeing prometeu construir seu próximo jato comercial, que ainda não foi anunciado, em uma fábrica sindicalizada.
Sem um contrato que inclua essa disposição, a Boeing pode decidir construir o jato em uma fábrica não sindicalizada.
Mas 95% dos membros do sindicato IAM votaram contra o acordo. Em uma votação separada, 96% votaram para autorizar uma greve, superando facilmente o limite de dois terços necessário para aprovar uma paralisação.
A greve está programada para começar nesta sexta-feira. Embora seja possível que um novo acordo seja fechado nas horas restantes, parece improvável que a greve possa ser evitada, dada o descontentamento dos membros do sindicato de base da empresa.
“Isso é sobre lutar pelo nosso futuro”, disse Jon Holden, presidente do maior IAM local na Boeing, ao anunciar os resultados da votação. “Voltaremos à mesa sempre que pudermos chegar lá para impulsionar as questões que nossos membros dizem ser importantes.”
A Boeing disse que também estava ansiosa para retornar à mesa de negociações para chegar a um novo acordo.
“A mensagem era clara de que o acordo provisório que alcançamos com a liderança do IAM não era aceitável para os membros”, disse em uma declaração. “Continuamos comprometidos em redefinir nosso relacionamento com nossos funcionários e o sindicato.”
Concessões passadas e uma série de problemas na Boeing, incluindo demissões e a mudança de parte do trabalho de uma fábrica de montagem sindicalizada para a única fábrica não sindicalizada da empresa, haviam provocado raiva generalizada na empresa. Então, o voto contra o contrato era esperado, apesar do que estava incluído na oferta.
No início desta semana, Kelly Ortberg, o novo CEO da Boeing, reconheceu que os membros estavam chateados com os termos dos contratos anteriores, mas pediu aos membros do sindicato que superassem isso e votassem a favor do acordo.
“Sei que a reação ao nosso acordo provisório com o IAM tem sido acalorada”, ele escreveu aos funcionários. “Eu entendo e respeito essa euforia, mas peço que vocês não sacrifiquem a oportunidade de garantir nosso futuro juntos, por causa das frustrações do passado.”
Ortberg disse em sua primeira semana no trabalho no mês passado que queria “reiniciar nosso relacionamento” com o sindicato.
Enquanto Holden disse à CNN no final do mês passado que não viu nenhuma mudança na estratégia de negociação desde que Ortberg assumiu o cargo mais alto, ele disse na quinta-feira à noite que não necessariamente culpou o novo chefe da empresa pela greve.
“É difícil compensar 16 anos”, ele disse. “É realmente [sobre] o que aconteceu com nossos membros … pela liderança da empresa por quase 20 anos.”

author: @nbc15_madison
title: Edgerton family finds way to care for pregnant goats after losing farm to tornado
text: Edgerton family finds way to care for pregnant goats after losing farm to tornado MADISON, Wis. (WMTV) - It’s been one week since historic tornadoes rolled through parts of Rock County. Now, impacted residents are continuing to recover from the damage left behind. Officials held a community meeting at Evansville High School Thursday night, giving an update on recovery efforts. One Edgerton family in attendance is looking to get their life back on track after the tornado destroyed much of their farm. “It sounded like a train ran through our house,” Gabriella Nelson said. That’s what Gabriella and her husband Ryan Nelson heard as a tornado hit their home. The aftermath left them searching for a new roof over their head. “Every day we wake up and we look outside and it’s just, it’s more than just the price tag,” Gabriella said. “It’s everything we worked for our whole life. It’s our American dream and it was gone overnight.” After the unprecedented storm ripped through their farm, the Nelson’s looked for ways to still live there and take care of their animals. They scrambled over the last week and ended up getting a mobile home. “I busted out in tears because I felt so blessed just knowing me and my kids and my husband will have somewhere safe to stay,” Gabriella said. The Nelson’s have 15 goats. Four of them are pregnant and are due within the next couple of weeks. “We were worried about the stress for them, and us being farmers, we really try to make sure our animals have the utmost care,” Gabriella said “I might not have sleep, but I want to make sure that they’re healthy and safe.” Gabriella runs a small business through her goats by making products out of goat milk. She’s unsure when it will return back to normal. “We lost all of our hay,” Gabriella said. “My business is going to be on pause for the unseeable future, knowing that we won’t have milk and supplies for that, or even a home.” The Nelsons now wait to see if their original home can be restored. They hope to have all 15 goats back on their farm soon. The other 11 are being taken care of by another person. [Click here](https://www.nbc15.com/page/find-nbc15-news-wherever-you-are/) to download the WMTV15 News app or our WMTV15 First Alert weather app. Copyright 2024 WMTV. All rights reserved.

author: Réseau International
title: La estrategia de hambruna de Israel
text: por mike whitney «No es casualidad que los ataques a la UNRWA se produjeran después del fallo de la CIJ. Israel está tratando de desacreditar a la Corte Internacional de Justicia, y una forma de hacerlo es denigrar a la UNWRA. Pero la UNWRA ha desempeñado un papel heroico al brindar servicios de salud, educación y otros servicios a los refugiados palestinos desde 1948. Es verdaderamente desgarrador que la propaganda israelí ahora demonice a la UNWRA y lleve a algunos países a cortar su ayuda. Por lo tanto, mi solidaridad y apoyo van enteramente a la UNWRA, y espero que pueda seguir desempeñando durante mucho tiempo el papel vital que siempre ha desempeñado en el apoyo a las víctimas palestinas de la agresión israelí.'. ( [Avi Shlaim](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_cQ7b03ggCI), historiador israelí, YouTube) La UNRWA garantiza la distribución de alimentos y harina a los 2,2 millones de habitantes de Gaza. Quitar fondos a la UNRWA conducirá a hambrunas y muertes masivas. Aquí está el cuestionario sionista del día: ¿Por qué Israel lanzó un verdadero bombardeo mediático contra una agencia de ayuda de las Naciones Unidas (UNRWA) el mismo día en que la Corte Penal Internacional (CPI) emitió su sentencia histórica sobre el genocidio? - Para distraer la atención del hecho de que Israel está cometiendo genocidio en Gaza. - Informar al público que ha salido a la luz nueva información sobre la participación de Hamas en la Agencia de Obras Públicas y Socorro de las Naciones Unidas para los Refugiados de Palestina en el Cercano Oriente (UNRWA). - Asegurar a los ciudadanos de todo el mundo que la principal preocupación de Israel es la lucha contra el terrorismo. - activar la fase final de su operación de limpieza étnica. Si respondió "4", dése una palmadita en la espalda porque esa es la respuesta correcta. Por supuesto, también es cierto que Israel quería distraer la atención del anuncio de la CIJ, pero eso palidece en comparación con el lanzamiento de la fase final de su operación de limpieza étnica. Este es el verdadero golpe de gracia, el golpe final a la solución de dos Estados y un remedio práctico al persistente problema demográfico de Israel. También es la pieza esencial del rompecabezas que da sentido a los más de 100 días pasados de incesantes bombardeos, ataques aéreos y otras formas de terrorismo de Estado. Es como si Israel estuviera deponiendo audazmente sus cartas para que el mundo entero pueda ver la estrategia que pretende emplear para erradicar a la población indígena y hacer realidad el sueño sionista de un Estado judío desde el río hasta el mar. ¿Y cuál podría ser esta estrategia? Dispersar a 2 millones de palestinos por todo el mundo mediante una inmigración masiva. ¿Pero cómo lo harán? Después de todo, ¿no se han negado ya varios países a dar la bienvenida a los palestinos? De hecho, lo hicieron, pero eso fue antes de que las fotos (que pronto se publicarán) de mujeres y niños hambrientos inundaran los sitios de redes sociales en todo el mundo, provocando una avalancha de simpatía sin precedentes por la población asediada. Y a medida que la simpatía pública conduce a una indignación generalizada, cada vez más personas exigirán que sus gobiernos tomen medidas para aliviar el sufrimiento a través de la inmigración masiva. Así es como Israel pretende deshacerse de su población indígena y crear un Valhalla sionista, una mayoría judía a perpetuidad. Esta es la razón por la que Israel lanzó su feroz ataque contra la UNWRA, porque la UNWRA –más que cualquier otra organización humanitaria que opera en el Medio Oriente– ayuda a alimentar y albergar a los palestinos, lo que va en contra de las intenciones explícitas de Israel. Lo último que Israel quiere es que los palestinos establezcan un enorme campo de refugiados cerca de Rafah, cuyo tamaño seguirá creciendo en los próximos años. Este fenómeno ya ha ocurrido en Jordania y el Líbano, donde casi 3 millones de palestinos todavía languidecen en campos de refugiados (75 años después del establecimiento del Estado de Israel) y todavía están decididos a regresar a casa un día u otro. Esto no es lo que Israel quiere. Israel quiere que los palestinos “desaparezcan en el aire”, y por eso los quiere dispersos por todo el mundo para que nunca se les pase por la cabeza la idea misma de regresar a casa. Por lo tanto, aunque los líderes israelíes no están contentos con el daño a su reputación causado por su trato a los palestinos, están dispuestos a soportarlo para lograr sus objetivos estratégicos más amplios, a saber, la erradicación completa de la población árabe y el fortalecimiento de una mayoría judía permanente. . La estrategia general de Israel fue mejor resumida por Daniella Weiss, ex alcaldesa de un asentamiento de Cisjordania, quien dijo lo siguiente en una breve entrevista en TikTok: «Se moverán. Se moverán. Los árabes se mudarán... Así que no les damos comida, no les damos nada a los árabes, y tendrán que irse. El mundo los aceptará.'. ( [Ojo de Medio Oriente](https://www.tiktok.com/@middleeasteye/video/7329510232520936737), Tik Tok) Éste es, en pocas palabras, el plan de Israel. fuente: [La revisión de Unz](https://www.unz.com/mwhitney/israels-starvation-strategy/) traduction [Réseau International](https://es.reseauinternational.net/)

author: John Papadopoulos
title: Doom: The Dark Ages Hits PC on May 15th + PC Requirements
text:
id Software has confirmed that Doom: The Dark Ages will be officially released on PC on May 15th. To celebrate this announcement, the team has shared a new trailer that you can find below.
Doom: The Dark Ages is the prequel to the critically acclaimed Doom (2016) and Doom Eternal. The prequel will tell an epic cinematic story of the Doom Slayer’s rage.
In this third installment of the modern Doom series, players will step into the blood-stained boots of the Doom Slayer, in this never-before-seen dark and sinister medieval war against Hell.
As we’ve already reported , Doom: The Dark Ages will support Full Ray Tracing/Path Tracing on PC. We can also expect it to support DLSS 4. As such, it will be interesting to test this game on the NVIDIA RTX 5090.
id Software has also revealed the game’s official PC system requirements. For gaming at 1080p/Low Settings with 60FPS, you’ll need an AMD Ryzen 7 3700X or Intel Core i7 10700K with 16GB of RAM and an NVIDIA RTX 2060 SUPER or AMD RX 6600. Do note that like Indiana Jones, Doom: The Dark Ages will require GPUs that support hardware Ray Tracing. The game will also require 100GB of free disk space.
The devs recommend using an AMD Ryzen 7 5700X or Intel Core i7 12700K with 32GB of RAM and an NVIDIA RTX 3080 or AMD RX 6800. With this PC system, you’ll be able to game at 1440p/High Settings with 60FPS.
Finally, id Software did not reveal any PC requirements for the game’s Full Ray Tracing/Path Tracing. My guess is that NVIDIA will share them at a later date.
Before closing, it’s worth noting that the game is priced at 79.99 euros. So, following Dynasty Warriors: Origins example, this is another game that will cost you 80 euros to get. Ouch.
Enjoy and stay tuned for more!
DOOM: The Dark Ages | Developer_Direct 2025 (4K) | Coming May 15, 2025
Watch this video on YouTube Doom: The Dark Ages PC Requirements Minimum:
Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system OS: Windows 10 64-Bit / Windows 11 64-Bit Processor: AMD Zen 2 or Intel 10th Generation CPU @3.2Ghz with 8 cores / 16 threads or better (examples: AMD Ryzen 7 3700X or better, or Intel Core i7 10700K or better) Memory: 16 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA or AMD hardware Raytracing-capable GPU with 8GB dedicated VRAM or better (examples: NVIDIA RTX 2060 SUPER or better, AMD RX 6600 or better) Storage: 100 GB available space Additional Notes: 1080p / 60 FPS / Low Quality Settings, NVME SSD storage required Recommended:
Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system OS: Windows 10 64-Bit / Windows 11 64-Bit Processor: AMD Zen 3 or Intel 12th Generation CPU @3.2Ghz with 8 cores / 16 threads or better (examples: AMD Ryzen 7 5700X or better, or Intel Core i7 12700K or better) Memory: 32 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA or AMD hardware Raytracing-capable GPU with 10GB dedicated VRAM or better (examples: NVIDIA RTX 3080 or better, AMD RX 6800 or better) Storage: 100 GB available space Additional Notes: 1440p / 60 FPS / High Quality Settings, NVME SSD storage required

author: Reuters
title: SOFTS-Sugar gains in the year's 1st trading session, arabica also up
text:
Adds comments and closing prices
NEW YORK, Jan 2 (Reuters) - Raw sugar futures on ICE started 2024 with gains, partly recovering the heavy losses of the last trading day of 2023, while arabica coffee also closed higher.
SUGAR
* March raw sugar SBc1 settled up 0.32 cent, or 1.6%, at 20.90 cents per lb, having lost 5.4% last Friday.
* Raw sugar gained 3% last year, with poor crops in India and Thailand largely offset by strong production in Centre-South Brazil.
* Indian mills' sugar production between Oct. 1 and Dec. 31 was down 7.6% from a year earlier, a leading industry body said.
* Dealers cited lower-than-normal rains in Brazil's Centre-South region late in the year, but noted that increasing moisture is forecast for the first half of January.
* Egypt's state grains buyer is seeking 50,000 metric tons of raw cane sugar and/or 50,000 tons of white sugar in a tender.
* March white sugar LSUc1 rose 1.5% to $605.00 a metric ton.
COFFEE
* March robusta coffee LRCc2 settled down $37, or 1.3%, at $2,804 a ton, after climbing 58% last year, thanks to a decline in exports from top producer Vietnam and strong demand from roasters.
* Dealers said farmers in Vietnam are seemingly unperturbed by current prices close to record highs and have adopted a reserved approach to selling in the hope of further gains.
* March arabica coffee KCc1 rose 1% to $1.9015 per lb, recovering from falls of 4.9% last Friday.
* Arabica gained 12.6% overall last year, but a favourable outlook for the next crop in top grower Brazil is limiting the upside.
COCOA
* March London cocoa LCCc1 settled up 67 pounds, or 1.9%, at 3,573 pounds per ton after touching its lowest in nearly two months at 3,498 pounds.
* London cocoa gained 70% last year against a backdrop of tight supplies, though speculators are becoming less bullish.
* Cocoa farmers in Ivory Coast cited good prospects for the April-to-September mid crop despite very little rainfall across all cocoa regions.
* March New York cocoa CCc1 rose 1.9% to $4,275 a ton.
(Reporting by Maytaal Angel and Marcelo Teixeira; Editing by David Goodman, David Evans and Richard Chang)
(( ; +1 332 220 8062; Reuters Messaging:
[marcelo.teixeira.thomsonreuters.com@reuters.net](rm://marcelo.teixeira.thomsonreuters.com@reuters.net) - https://twitter.com/tx_marcelo))
